Handicap index:
- Deemples currently uses the USGA handicap formula and is not recognised or an official handicap of any golf club.
- Golfers use the Deemples handicap because the scores used to calculate the handicap cannot be submitted by them.
- This requires 2 other golfers in the Deemples game to submit the same adjusted gross score, course rating, and slope rating for the golfer in order for it to count for handicapping purposes.
- This submission method makes it the most trusted and non-manipulable golf handicap.
- The Deemples handicap will be moving to the World Handicap System in due time.

Ianseo is a software for managing the results of an Archery Tournament; it is an Open Source Project developed thanks to the Italian Archery Federation's financial support, that decided to freely distribute it in whole Europe. Translated in several languages, Ianseo is the most up to date and advanced in the world integrating all the World Archery rules, but has evolved to include a comprehensive management of an Archery Tournament as a whole: from accreditation of the athletes and officers to every kind of printouts utilities, from network and online integration to field-of-play design.

Never get lost again with access to downloadable trail maps, right on your phone. And before you head up the mountain, check what other riders are saying about the snow quality at a resort.

Slopes will automatically detect lifts and runs for you all day long. And with its Smart Reminders system, it can ping you if you get to a lift and hadn’t started recording yet (based on your list of resorts), or if you drive away and forgot to stop recording.

Uncover a wealth of information about your performance, know your speed, vertical, run times, distance, and more. Find out how good you are and how you’re getting even better, season-over-season.
